1.text: And make an altar for burning incense: of acacia wood shalt thou make it.

2.text: A cubit its length, a cubit its breadth; it shall be four-square; and two cubits its height: its horns out of it.

3.text: And spread it over with pure gold its top, and its walls round about, and its horns: and make to it a gold wreath round about.

4.text: And two gold rings shalt thou make to it from under its crown, upon its two ribs, shalt thou make upon its two sides; and it was for inner parts for staves to lift it up by them.

5.text: And make staves of acacia wood, and spread them over with gold.

6.text: And give it before the vail that is upon the ark of the testimonies, before the cover which is upon the testimonies, where I will meet with thee there.

7.text: And Aaron to burn upon it incense of spices in the morning: in the morning in his adorning the lamps, he shall burn incense upon it.

8.text: And in Aaronâ€™s causing the lamps, to ascend between the two evenings, he shall burn incense upon it; continually before Jehovah for your generations.

9.text: And ye shall not bring up upon it strange incense; and a burnt-offering, a sacrifice and a libation thou shalt not pour out upon it.

10.text: And Aaron to expiate upon its horns once in a year, from the blood of the sin of the expiation: once in a year he shall expiate upon it for your generations: it is holy of holies to Jehovah.

11.text: And Jehovah will speak to Moses, saying,

12.text: When thou shalt take up the head of the sons of Israel for their reviewing, and they gave each a ransom of his soul to Jehovah, and in reviewing them; and a stumble shall not be in them in reviewing them.

13.text: This they shall give, all passing by upon their reviewing, from half the shekel by the holy shekel; (twenty gerahs the shekel:) from half a shekel an offering to Jehovah.

14.text: All passing by upon their reviewing, from the son of twenty years and above, shall give an offering to Jehovah.

15.text: The rich one shall not multiply, and the poor one shall not diminish from half the shekel, to give an offering to Jehovah to expiate for your souls.

16.text: And take the silver of the expiations from the sons of Israel and give it for the work of the tent of appointment; and it was for the sons of Israel a remembrance before Jehovah to expiate for your souls.

17.text: And Jehovah will speak to Moses, saying,

18.text: Make a brass wash-basin, and its pedestal brass, for washing: and give it between the tent of appointment and between the altar, and give water there.

19.text: And Aaron and his son washed from it their hands and their feet.

20.text: In their coming into the tent of appointment, they shall wash with water, and they shall not die: or in their drawing near to the altar to serve, to burn a sacrifice to Jehovah.

21.text: And they shall wash their hands and their feet, and they shall not die: and it was to them a law forever, to him and to his seed and to their generations.

22.text: And Jehovah will speak to Moses, saying.

23.text: Take thou to thee spices of head of flowing myrrh, five hundred: and fragrant cinnamon of its half, fifty and two hundred; and fragrant reed, fifty and two hundred.

24.text: And cassia, five hundred by the holy shekel, and the oil of olive, a hin:

25.text: And make it an oil a holy anointing, a perfumed unguent the work of the perfumer: it shall be an oil a holy anointing.

26.text: And anoint the tent of appointment, and the ark of the testimony,

27.text: And the table and all its vessels and the chandelier and its vessels, and the altar of incense,

28.text: And the altar of burnt-offering and all its vessels, and the wash-basin and its pedestal.

29.text: And consecrate them, and they shall be holy of holies; every one touching upon them shall be holy.

30.text: And Aaron and his sons thou shalt anoint and consecrate them to be priests to me.

31.text: And to the sons of Israel thou shalt speak, saying, An oil a holy anointing shall this be to me for your generations.

32.text: Upon the flesh of man it shall not be poured, and according to its measure ye shall not make like it: it is holy; holy shall it be to you.

33.text: A man who shall perfume like it, and shall give to the stranger, and he shall be cut off from his people.

34.text: And Jehovah will say to Moses, Take to thee aromatics, resin, and onycha, and galbanum; aromatics and pure frankincense: it shall be part for part.

35.text: And make it a perfume, an ointment, a work of the perfumer, salted, pure, holy.

36.text: And pound fine from it to small dust, and give from it before the testimony in the tent of appointment where I will meet with thee there: holy of holies, shall it be to you.

37.text: And the perfume which thou shalt make, according to its measure ye shall not make to you: it shall be holy to you for Jehovah.

38.text: A man who shall make like it to smell in it, and he shall be cut off from his people.
